00021 #include <assert.h>
00022 #include <stdio.h>
00023 #include <stdlib.h>
00024 #include <string.h>
00025 #include <time.h>
00026 
00027 #include "test-harness.h"
00028 
00029 #include "dbprim.h"
00030 #include "dbprim_int.h"
00031 
00032 RCSTAG("@(#)$Id$");
00033 
00034 TEST_PROG(t_redblack, "Test red-black tree functionality")
00035 
00036 #define RBT_ELEM_CNT    32
00037 
00038 /* this is so complicated because RBT_ELEM_CNT is likely the maximum number
00039  * of bits representable in an unsigned long, so we have to look out for
00040  * overflows.
00041  */
00042 #define RBT_ELEM_MASK   ((((0x01lu << (RBT_ELEM_CNT - 1)) - 1) << 1) | 0x01lu)
00043 
00044 /* recursive routine for obtaining pre-order list... */
00045 static void
00046 _make_pre(rb_node_t *node, int *order, int *idx, int reverse,
00047           unsigned long *visited)
00048 {
00049   order[(*idx)++] = (int)rn_value(node); /* store node... */
00050   if (reverse && rn_right(node)) /* recurse down the right if reversed */
00051     _make_pre(rn_right(node), order, idx, reverse, visited);
00052   if (rn_left(node)) /* recurse down the left */
00053     _make_pre(rn_left(node), order, idx, reverse, visited);
00054   if (!reverse && rn_right(node)) /* recurse down the right if not reversed */
00055     _make_pre(rn_right(node), order, idx, reverse, visited);
00056 
00057   *visited &= ~(0x01ul << (int)rn_value(node));
00058 }
00059 
00060 /* recursive routine for obtaining in-order list... */
00061 static void
00062 _make_in(rb_node_t *node, int *order, int *idx, int reverse,
00063          unsigned long *visited)
00064 {
00065 #define selnode(n, rev) ((rev) ? rn_right(n) : rn_left(n))
00066   if (selnode(node, reverse)) /* recurse down one subtree... */
00067     _make_in(selnode(node, reverse), order, idx, reverse, visited);
00068   order[(*idx)++] = (int)rn_value(node); /* store node... */
00069   if (selnode(node, !reverse)) /* recurse down other subtree... */
00070     _make_in(selnode(node, !reverse), order, idx, reverse, visited);
00071 
00072   *visited &= ~(0x01ul << (int)rn_value(node));
00073 }
00074 
00075 /* recursive routine for obtaining post-order list... */
00076 static void
00077 _make_post(rb_node_t *node, int *order, int *idx, int reverse,
00078            unsigned long *visited)
00079 {
00080   if (reverse && rn_right(node)) /* recurse down the right if reversed */
00081     _make_post(rn_right(node), order, idx, reverse, visited);
00082   if (rn_left(node)) /* recurse down the left */
00083     _make_post(rn_left(node), order, idx, reverse, visited);
00084   if (!reverse && rn_right(node)) /* recurse down the right if not reversed */
00085     _make_post(rn_right(node), order, idx, reverse, visited);
00086   order[(*idx)++] = (int)rn_value(node); /* store node... */
00087 
00088   *visited &= ~(0x01ul << (int)rn_value(node));
00089 }
00090 
00091 /* calculate the order of nodes in the traversal of an redblack tree */
00092 static void
00093 make_order(rb_tree_t *tree, int *order, unsigned long flags,
00094            unsigned long *visited)
00095 {
00096   int idx = 0;
00097 
00098   switch (flags) {
00099   case RBT_ORDER_PRE: /* get the pre-order list */
00100   case RBT_ORDER_POST | DB_FLAG_REVERSE:
00101     _make_pre(rt_root(tree), order, &idx, flags & DB_FLAG_REVERSE, visited);
00102     break;
00103   case RBT_ORDER_IN: /* get the in-order list */
00104   case RBT_ORDER_IN | DB_FLAG_REVERSE:
00105     _make_in(rt_root(tree), order, &idx, flags & DB_FLAG_REVERSE, visited);
00106     break;
00107   case RBT_ORDER_POST: /* get the post-order list */
00108   case RBT_ORDER_PRE | DB_FLAG_REVERSE:
00109     _make_post(rt_root(tree), order, &idx, flags & DB_FLAG_REVERSE, visited);
00110     break;
00111   }
00112 }
00113 
00114 /* compare two sets of orders... */
00115 static int
00116 comp_order(int *o1, int *o2)
00117 {
00118   int i;
00119 
00120   fprintf(stderr, "Ordering comparison:");
00121   for (i = 0; i < RBT_ELEM_CNT; i++) { /* walk through all the elements */
00122     fprintf(stderr, " %d", o1[i]);
00123     if (o1[i] != o2[i]) {
00124       fprintf(stderr, "!= %d!\n", o2[i]);
00125       return 0; /* oops, mismatch... */
00126     }
00127   }
00128   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00129 
00130   return 1; /* OK, everything's fine. */
00131 }
00132 
00133 /* handy macro to generate the arguments for identifying nodes in printf's */
00134 #define n_debargs(node) (void *)(node), (node) ? dk_len(rn_key(node)) : -1, \
00135                         rn_isblack(node) ? "BLACK" : \
00136                         (rn_isred(node) ? "RED" : "NO COLOR")
00137 
00138 /* check that a tree really is a red-black tree */
00139 static int
00140 treecheck(rb_node_t *node, rb_node_t *parent, int bh, int *tbhp)
00141 {
00142   int init_bh = -1; /* tree black height */
00143 
00144   if (!node) /* an empty tree is a red-black tree... */
00145     return 1;
00146 
00147   /* First, check parental referential integrity... */
00148   if (node->rn_parent != parent) {
00149     fprintf(stderr, "Node %p/%d (%s) thinks its a child of %p/%d (%s) "
00150             "rather than of %p/%d (%s)\n", n_debargs(node),
00151             n_debargs(node->rn_parent), n_debargs(parent));
00152     return 0;
00153   }
00154 
00155   /* Next, make sure it has a reasonable color... */
00156   if (!rn_isred(node) && !rn_isblack(node)) {
00157     fprintf(stderr, "Node %p/%d (%s) is neither red nor black\n",
00158             n_debargs(node));
00159     return 0;
00160   }
00161 
00162   /* Now, if it's at the root of the tree, it'd better be black */
00163   if (!parent && !rn_isblack(node)) {
00164     fprintf(stderr, "Node %p/%d (%s) is a non-black root node\n",
00165             n_debargs(node->rn_parent));
00166     return 0;
00167   }
00168 
00169   /* No red node may have a red parent */
00170   if (rn_isred(parent) && rn_isred(node)) {
00171     fprintf(stderr, "Node %p/%d (%s) is a red node with a red parent "
00172             "%p/%d (%s)\n", n_debargs(node), n_debargs(parent));
00173     return 0;
00174   }
00175 
00176   if (!tbhp) /* need a pointer to the total black height... */
00177     tbhp = &init_bh; /* so use ours */
00178 
00179   if (parent && rn_isblack(node)) /* increment black height (for children) */
00180     bh++;
00181 
00182   /* Check that the left node is part of a red-black tree */
00183   if (node->rn_left) {
00184     /* First, double-check node ordering... */
00185     if (dk_len(rn_key(node->rn_left)) >= dk_len(rn_key(node))) {
00186       fprintf(stderr, "Node %p/%d (%s) is less than its left child, "
00187               "%p/%d (%s)", n_debargs(node), n_debargs(node->rn_left));
00188       return 0;
00189     } else if (!treecheck(node->rn_left, node, bh, tbhp))
00190      return 0;
00191   } else if (*tbhp < 0) /* hit an external node for the first time... */
00192     *tbhp = bh + 1; /* store the black height */
00193   else if ((bh + 1) != *tbhp) { /* verify that black heights are consistent */
00194     fprintf(stderr, "Node %p/%d (%s) left child is leaf with bh %d "
00195             "(expected %d)\n", n_debargs(node), bh + 1, *tbhp);
00196     return 0;
00197   }
00198 
00199   /* Check that the right node is part of a red-black tree */
00200   if (node->rn_right) {
00201     /* First, double-check node ordering... */
00202     if (dk_len(rn_key(node)) >= dk_len(rn_key(node->rn_right))) {
00203       fprintf(stderr, "Node %p/%d (%s) is greater than its right child, "
00204               "%p/%d (%s)", n_debargs(node), n_debargs(node->rn_left));
00205       return 0;
00206     } else if (!treecheck(node->rn_right, node, bh, tbhp))
00207       return 0;
00208   } else if (*tbhp < 0) /* hit an external node for the first time... */
00209     *tbhp = bh + 1; /* store the black height */
00210   else if ((bh + 1) != *tbhp) { /* verify that black heights are consistent */
00211     fprintf(stderr, "Node %p/%d (%s) right child is leaf with bh %d "
00212             "(expected %d)\n", n_debargs(node), bh + 1, *tbhp);
00213     return 0;
00214   }
00215 
00216   /* at this point, if we're the root, the black height had better be set */
00217   assert(parent || *tbhp > 0);
00218 
00219   /* Informational message... */
00220   if (!parent)
00221     fprintf(stderr, "Tree black height: %d\n", *tbhp);
00222 
00223   return 1; /* it's a red-black tree. */
00224 }
00225 
00226 /* simple comparison function for testing... */
00227 static long
00228 t_comp(rb_tree_t *tree, db_key_t *key1, db_key_t *key2)
00229 {
00230   return dk_len(key1) - dk_len(key2); /* difference of the lengths */
00231 }
00232 
00233 /* structure to keep track of flush testing... */
00234 struct flush_test {
00235   int stop_node;
00236   unsigned long visited;
00237 };
00238 
00239 #define STOP_RETURN     77
00240 #define VISIT_RETURN    89
00241 
00242 /* simple iterator for testing flushing... */
00243 static unsigned long
00244 t_flush(rb_tree_t *tree, rb_node_t *node, struct flush_test *ft)
00245 {
00246   fprintf(stderr, "t_flush(%d)\n", dk_len(rn_key(node)));
00247 
00248   /* have we visited this node before? */
00249   if (!(ft->visited & (0x01lu << dk_len(rn_key(node)))))
00250     return VISIT_RETURN;
00251 
00252   /* remember that we visited it... */
00253   ft->visited &= ~(0x01lu << dk_len(rn_key(node)));
00254 
00255   /* if we're supposed to stop here, do so... */
00256   return (dk_len(rn_key(node)) == ft->stop_node) ? STOP_RETURN : 0;
00257 }
00258 
00259 /* structure for testing iteration */
00260 struct iter_test {
00261   unsigned long visited;
00262   int stop_node;
00263   rb_node_t *last_node;
00264   int idx;
00265   int order[RBT_ELEM_CNT];
00266 };
00267 
00268 #define ITER_TRIALS     10
00269 
00270 /* simple iterator for testing iteration... */
00271 static unsigned long
00272 t_iter(rb_tree_t *tree, rb_node_t *node, struct iter_test *it)
00273 {
00274   fprintf(stderr, "t_iter(%d)\n", dk_len(rn_key(node)));
00275 
00276   /* have we visited this node already? */
00277   if (!(it->visited & (0x01lu << dk_len(rn_key(node)))))
00278     return VISIT_RETURN;
00279 
00280   /* remember that we visited it... */
00281   it->visited &= ~(0x01lu << dk_len(rn_key(node)));
00282 
00283   /* store the node value in the order array... */
00284   it->order[it->idx++] = dk_len(rn_key(node));
00285 
00286   it->last_node = node; /* remember the node... */
00287 
00288   /* so that if we're supposed to stop here, we can continue on later... */
00289   return (dk_len(rn_key(node)) == it->stop_node) ? STOP_RETURN : 0;
00290 }
00291 
00292 int
00293 main(int argc, char **argv)
00294 {
00295   unsigned long err;
00296   rb_tree_t tree; /* a red-black tree to play with... */
00297   rb_node_t nodes[RBT_ELEM_CNT];
00298   rb_node_t *n = 0;
00299   db_key_t key = DB_KEY_INIT(0, 0);
00300   int i, tmp, order[RBT_ELEM_CNT];
00301   unsigned long visited, visit_init, ordering;
00302   struct flush_test ft;
00303   struct iter_test it;
00304 
00305   srand(time(0)); /* seed random number generator */
00306 
00307   /* Let's test rt_init() first... */
00308   TEST(t_redblack, rt_init, "Test that rt_init() may be called",
00309        (!(err = rt_init(&tree, t_comp, 0))), FATAL(0),
00310        ("rt_init() call successful"),
00311        ("rt_init() call failed with error %lu", err));
00312 
00313   /* Now try some rn_init()s... */
00314   TEST_DECL(t_redblack, rn_init, "Test that rn_init() may be called")
00315   for (i = 0; i < RBT_ELEM_CNT; i++)
00316     if ((err = rn_init(&nodes[i], (void *)i)))
00317       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rn_init), FATAL(0), "rn_init() failed with error %lu",
00318            err);
00319   PASS(TEST_NAME(rn_init), "rn_init() calls successful");
00320 
00321   /* OK, now we gotta add some nodes to the tree with rt_add()... */
00322   TEST_DECL(t_redblack, rt_add, "Test that rt_add() adds entries to the tree")
00323   for (dk_len(&key) = 0; dk_len(&key) < RBT_ELEM_CNT; dk_len(&key)++)
00324     if ((err = rt_add(&tree, &nodes[dk_len(&key)], &key)))
00325       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_add), FATAL(0), "rt_add() failed with error %lu", err);
00326     else if (!treecheck(rt_root(&tree), 0, 0, 0))
00327       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_add), FATAL(0), "rt_add() corrupted tree's "
00328            "red-black property");
00329   PASS(TEST_NAME(rt_add), "rt_add() calls successful");
00330 
00331   /* Next, try a few rt_find()s... */
00332   TEST_DECL(t_redblack, rt_find, "Test that rt_find() finds entries in tree")
00333   for (visited = RBT_ELEM_MASK; visited;
00334        visited &= ~(0x01lu << dk_len(&key))) {
00335     dk_len(&key) = rand() % RBT_ELEM_CNT; /* select an entry at random... */
00336     fprintf(stderr, "Looking up entry %d . . .\n", dk_len(&key));
00337     if ((err = rt_find(&tree, &n, &key)))
00338       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_find), FATAL(0), "rt_find() failed with error %lu",
00339            err);
00340     else if (n != &nodes[dk_len(&key)])
00341       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_find), FATAL(0), "rt_find() found wrong entry; "
00342            "expected %d returned %d", dk_len(&key), n ? -1 : n - nodes);
00343   }
00344   PASS(TEST_NAME(rt_find), "rt_find() calls successful");
00345 
00346   /* Let's try removing some nodes with rt_remove()... */
00347   TEST_DECL(t_redblack, rt_remove, "Test that rt_remove() removes nodes")
00348   for (visit_init = RBT_ELEM_MASK; rt_count(&tree) > RBT_ELEM_CNT / 2;
00349        visit_init &= ~(0x01lu << tmp)) {
00350     tmp = rand() % RBT_ELEM_CNT; /* select an entry at random... */
00351 
00352     if (!(visit_init & (0x01lu << tmp))) /* already removed... */
00353       continue; /* so skip it */
00354 
00355     fprintf(stderr, "Removing element %d . . .\n", tmp);
00356 
00357     if ((err = rt_remove(&tree, &nodes[tmp])))
00358       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_remove), FATAL(0), "rt_remove() failed with error %lu",
00359            err);
00360     else if (!treecheck(rt_root(&tree), 0, 0, 0))
00361       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_remove), FATAL(0), "rt_remove() corrupted tree's "
00362            "red-black property");
00363   }
00364   /* Now see if we can still locate elements in the tree... */
00365   for (visited = RBT_ELEM_MASK; visited;
00366        visited &= ~(0x01lu << dk_len(&key))) {
00367     dk_len(&key) = rand() % RBT_ELEM_CNT; /* select an entry at random... */
00368     fprintf(stderr, "Looking up entry %d . . .%s\n", dk_len(&key),
00369             (visit_init & (0x01lu << dk_len(&key))) ? "" : "[removed]");
00370 
00371     err = rt_find(&tree, &n, &key); /* look up the node */
00372 
00373     if (err != ((visit_init & (0x01lu << dk_len(&key))) ? 0 : DB_ERR_NOENTRY))
00374       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_remove), FATAL(0), "rt_remove() (probably) corrupted "
00375            "the tree bad enough that rt_find() returned error %lu", err);
00376   }
00377   PASS(TEST_NAME(rt_remove), "rt_remove() calls successful");
00378 
00379   /* test tree flushes... */
00380   TEST_DECL(t_redblack, rt_flush, "Test that rt_flush() flushes the tree")
00381   for (ft.stop_node = rand() % RBT_ELEM_CNT; /* select an element to stop on */
00382        !(visit_init & (0x01lu << ft.stop_node));
00383        ft.stop_node = rand() % RBT_ELEM_CNT)
00384     ; /* empty loop */
00385   ft.visited = visit_init; /* need to know what's been removed... */
00386   switch (err = rt_flush(&tree, (rb_iter_t)t_flush, (void *)&ft)) {
00387   case STOP_RETURN: /* this is what it should return... */
00388     break;
00389   case VISIT_RETURN: /* visited the same node twice?!? */
00390     FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_flush), FATAL(0), "rt_flush() visited the same node "
00391          "twice!");
00392     break;
00393   case 0: /* it's supposed to error out! */
00394     FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_flush), FATAL(0), "rt_flush() failed to stop when told "
00395          "to do so");
00396     break;
00397   default: /* OK, some other error... */
00398     FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_flush), FATAL(0), "rt_flush() failed with error %lu",
00399          err);
00400     break;
00401   }
00402   switch (err = rt_flush(&tree, (rb_iter_t)t_flush, (void *)&ft)) {
00403   case 0: /* this is what it should return... */
00404     break;
00405   case VISIT_RETURN: /* visited the same node twice?!? */
00406     FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_flush), FATAL(0), "rt_flush() visited the same node "
00407          "twice!");
00408     break;
00409   default: /* some other error occurred... */
00410     FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_flush), FATAL(0), "rt_flush() failed with error %lu",
00411          err);
00412     break;
00413   }
00414   if (ft.visited || rt_count(&tree)) /* did it visit all elements? */
00415     FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_flush), FATAL(0), "rt_flush() failed to visit all "
00416          "elements");
00417   PASS(TEST_NAME(rt_flush), "rt_flush() calls successful");
00418 
00419   /* OK, let's test iteration... */
00420   TEST_DECL(t_redblack, rt_iter, "Test that rt_iter() iterates over the "
00421             "tree in the correct order")
00422   for (i = 0; i < ITER_TRIALS; i++) {
00423     /* First, select an ordering to try... */
00424     for (ordering = rand() & 0x07;
00425          !(ordering & RBT_ORDER_MASK);
00426          ordering = rand() & 0x07)
00427       ; /* empty loop */
00428     ordering = (ordering & RBT_ORDER_MASK) | ((ordering & 0x04) << 29);
00429 
00430     fprintf(stderr, "rt_iter() trial %d: ordering 0x%08lx\n", i, ordering);
00431 
00432     /* Next, populate the tree...in random order. */
00433     for (visited = 0, tmp = 0; tmp < RBT_ELEM_CNT; ) {
00434       /* select a unique element for each iteration */
00435       if (visited & (0x01lu << (dk_len(&key) = rand() % RBT_ELEM_CNT)))
00436         continue;
00437       fprintf(stderr, "Adding node %d...\n", dk_len(&key));
00438       if ((err = rt_add(&tree, &nodes[dk_len(&key)], &key)))
00439         FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_iter), FATAL(0), "rt_add() failed with error %lu "
00440              "while testing rt_iter()", err);
00441       else if (!treecheck(rt_root(&tree), 0, 0, 0))
00442         FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_iter), FATAL(0), "rt_add() corrupted tree's "
00443              "red-black property while testing rt_iter()");
00444       it.order[tmp] = -1; /* just throw this in here so we don't loop again */
00445       order[tmp] = -1; /* this too... */
00446       tmp++; /* OK, we've added one element... */
00447       visited |= (0x01lu << dk_len(&key)); /* mark that we've added that one */
00448     }
00449 
00450     /* Now, fill in iter_test and select an element at random to stop at... */
00451     it.visited = visited;
00452     it.stop_node = rand() % RBT_ELEM_CNT;
00453     it.last_node = 0;
00454     it.idx = 0; /* start at the beginning of the array... */
00455 
00456     /* OK, let's iterate! */
00457     fprintf(stderr, "First rt_iter(): stop on node %d\n", it.stop_node);
00458     switch ((err = rt_iter(&tree, 0, (rb_iter_t)t_iter, &it, ordering))) {
00459     case STOP_RETURN: /* this is what's supposed to happen... */
00460       assert(dk_len(rn_key(it.last_node)) == it.stop_node); /* uh... */
00461       break;
00462     case 0: /* uh, this isn't supposed to happen */
00463       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_iter), FATAL(0), "rt_iter() failed to stop when "
00464            "directed to do so");
00465       break;
00466     default: /* some other error; hmm.... */
00467       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_iter), FATAL(0), "rt_iter() failed with error %lu",
00468            err);
00469       break;
00470     }
00471 
00472     /* get the next element to start at... */
00473     fprintf(stderr, "Selecting successor to %d...\n", it.stop_node);
00474     if ((err = rt_next(&tree, &it.last_node, ordering)))
00475       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_iter), FATAL(0), "rt_next() failed with error %lu",
00476            err);
00477     else if (it.last_node && dk_len(rn_key(it.last_node)) == it.stop_node)
00478       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_iter), FATAL(0), "rt_next() failed to retrieve a "
00479            "different node than node %d...", it.stop_node);
00480 
00481     /* Now finish up the iteration... */
00482     if (it.last_node) { /* if there was a next node, that is... */
00483       fprintf(stderr, "Starting second rt_iter() at node %d\n",
00484               dk_len(rn_key(it.last_node)));
00485       if ((err = rt_iter(&tree, it.last_node, (rb_iter_t)t_iter, &it,
00486                          ordering)))
00487         FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_iter), FATAL(0), "rt_iter() failed with error %lu",
00488              err);
00489       else if (it.visited)
00490         FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_iter), FATAL(0), "rt_iter() failed to visit all "
00491              "nodes");
00492     }
00493 
00494     /* OK, let's make the ordering recursively to verify... */
00495     make_order(&tree, order, ordering, &visited);
00496 
00497     assert(!visited); /* make_order() had better have visited everything... */
00498 
00499     /* Now, compare the orderings and see if they match... */
00500     if (!comp_order(order, it.order))
00501       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_iter), FATAL(0), "rt_iter() visited nodes in the "
00502            "wrong order");
00503 
00504     /* And last, but certainly not least, flush the tree for the next loop */
00505     if ((err = rt_flush(&tree, 0, 0)))
00506       FAIL(TEST_NAME(rt_iter), FATAL(0), "rt_flush() failed with error %lu "
00507            "while testing rt_iter()", err);
00508   }
00509   PASS(TEST_NAME(rt_iter), "rt_iter() calls successful");
00510 
00511   return 0;
00512 }
Generated on Thu Jul 13 16:41:47 2006 for @PACKAGE_NAME@ by  1.4.4
